Returns: true if the given DES-EDE key is parity-adjusted, false otherwise
Parameters: byte: a byte array which holds the key value
int: the offset into the byte array
Throws: if the given key material, starting at offset inclusive, is shorter than 24 bytes
isParityAdjusted(byte[],int).Description: Checks if the given DES-EDE key, starting at offset inclusive, is parity-adjusted.
isParityAdjusted(byte[],int).FullName: public static boolean isParityAdjusted (byte[] key, int offset)

Parameters: byte: the buffer with the DES-EDE key material. The first 24 bytes of the buffer are copied to protect against subsequent modification.
Throws: if the given key material is shorter than 24 bytes.
DESedeKeySpec(byte[]).Description: Creates a DESedeKeySpec object using the first 24 bytes in key as the key material for the DES-EDE key. The bytes that constitute the DES-EDE key are those between key[0] and key[23] inclusive

Returns: the DES-EDE key. Returns a new array each time this method is called.
true if the given DES-EDE key is parity-adjusted, false otherwise
Parameters: byte: a byte array which holds the key value
int: the offset into the byte array
Throws: if the given key material, starting at offset inclusive, is shorter than 24 bytes
isParityAdjusted(byte[], int).Description: Checks if the given DES-EDE key, starting at offset inclusive, is parity-adjusted.
isParityAdjusted(byte[], int).FullName: public static boolean isParityAdjusted (byte[] key, int offset)

Parameters: byte: the buffer with the DES-EDE key material. The first 24 bytes of the buffer beginning at offset inclusive are copied to protect against subsequent modification.
int: the offset in key, where the DES-EDE key material starts.
Throws: if the given key material, starting at offset inclusive, is shorter than 24 bytes
DESedeKeySpec(byte[],int).Description: Creates a DESedeKeySpec object using the first 24 bytes in key, beginning at offset inclusive, as the key material for the DES-EDE key. The bytes that constitute the DES-EDE key are those between key[offset] and key[offset+23] inclusive.

Parameters: byte: the buffer with the DES-EDE key material. The first 24 bytes of the buffer beginning at offset inclusive are copied to protect against subsequent modification.
int: the offset in key, where the DES-EDE key material starts.
Throws: if the given key material, starting at offset inclusive, is shorter than 24 bytes
DESedeKeySpec(byte[], int).Description: Creates a DESedeKeySpec object using the first 24 bytes in key, beginning at offset inclusive, as the key material for the DES-EDE key. The bytes that constitute the DES-EDE key are those between key[offset] and key[offset+23] inclusive.

ClassDesc: This class specifies a DES-EDE ("triple-DES") key.
